definitions.definition: (plural mink or minks) Any of various semi-aquatic, carnivorous mammals in the Mustelinae subfamily, similar to weasels, with dark fur, native to Europe and America, of which two species in different genera are extant: the American mink (Neovison vison) and the European mink (Mustela lutreola).
(plural mink) The fur or pelt of a mink, used to make apparel.
(plural minks) An article of clothing made of mink.
(plural minks) An individual with poor personal hygiene; a smelly person.
